title: Tides Of Intrigue

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: I see... So, that's what's going on. Thank you for bringing it to my attention. I'm very sorry your village was affected by this. You have my sincere apologies.

intro.speaker: Brom
intro.line: Oh, no, Your Majesty. We don't need no apology. We're just happy we could help.

intro.speaker: Geoffrey
intro.line: Lucia... Brom's story confirms what we've suspected all along.

intro.speaker: Lucia
intro.line: Yes, as we thought. Duke Ludveck of Felirae is firing up a rebellion. We should have seen it coming. To be honest, Queen Elincia, there have been a number of indications that something like this was under way. We'd hoped to uncover something more tangible than hushed rumors... I should have told you sooner.

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: No... I bear some responsibility as well. The discontent among the populace...is due to my lack of experience as a ruler. Now that a rebellion is gaining momentum, innocent blood will surely be spilled...

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: I have always held the well-being of the Crimean people as my highest priority... I've done my utmost in Crimea's name. ...And all I've ever desired is a country where war and hunger are unknown.

intro.speaker: Brom
intro.line: Beggin' your pardon, Queen Elincia.

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: ...Yes, Brom?

intro.speaker: Brom
intro.line: Your Majesty is doin' a bang-up job of it. This country's a safe place to live, and that's more than most can say! Once you get the hang of things, I'm sure you'll be the name future kings and queens try to live up to. We know you can do it!

intro.speaker: Nephenee
intro.line: And it ain't like ALL the young bucks out there got bees in their bonnets! There's a whole mess o' folk doin' their darnedest to make this a fine country. They wanna make you proud, Your Majesty.

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: I... Thank you.

intro.speaker: Geoffrey
intro.line: All nations experience unrest when the reins of leadership change hands. It's true the world over. But for Ludveck to start beating the drums of war as if this were unheard of... What utter nonsense! We must not allow it! Your Majesty, would you be so kind as to appoint me to the task of his capture? I myself will march into Felirae and seize Ludveck and his rebels.

intro.speaker: Lucia
intro.line: No, Geoffrey. We can't do that. Unfortunately, we don't have enough evidence to arrest him.

intro.speaker: Geoffrey
intro.line: But...

intro.speaker: Lucia
intro.line: Don't worry, Brother. If we have no evidence, then I suppose we'll have to dig some up. Your Majesty, I'd like to take on that job.

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: Lucia, I appreciate your dedication. You have my permission to proceed...

intro.speaker: Ludveck
intro.line: Well, well... My dear Lady Lucia. Quite a way from home, aren't we?

intro.speaker: Lucia
intro.line: Please do excuse the sudden visit, Your Grace. Princess Leanne, Lady Lethe... This is Lord Ludveck, duke of Felirae. I was thinking that our laguz guests might enjoy the fine fruits this region is known for. We've traveled quite a long way... I hope it won't be too much trouble.

intro.speaker: Ludveck
intro.line: Don't be ridiculous! I could be nothing but delighted by a visit from you, Lady Lucia. Although I must admit... I would be all the more pleased if you had come such a long way just to see me.

intro.speaker: Lucia
intro.line: ...You are too kind, Lord Ludveck.

intro.speaker: Ludveck
intro.line: Please, feel free to take your ease. You are welcome to stay in Felirae as long as you desire.

intro.speaker: Lucia
intro.line: ...This is it! This document is an order written by Ludveck himself, marked with his signal. If we show this to the royal assembly, we'll surely have the backing to indict him. Thank you so much...both of you. We have to quell this uprising before things get out of hand.

intro.speaker: Mordecai
intro.line: If there is no war, we are happy. But if there is war, it is good we came.

intro.speaker: Lethe
intro.line: Ludveck is poor prey. He hides behind a shield of words, not realizing that words can be seen through.

intro.speaker: Lucia
intro.line: Yes, and that's quite fortunate for us. But we still have to get out of here without being detected.
M-my lady! You mustn't raise your voice...

intro.speaker: Lucia
intro.line: Who's there?! Show yourself!

intro.speaker: Lucia
intro.line: Princess Leanne! Sir Nealuchi! I thought you had returned to the royal palace... What in the world are you doing here?!

intro.speaker: Nealuchi
intro.line: Oh ho ho... Forgive us... We just couldn't help but be concerned for you.

intro.speaker: Lucia
intro.line: Well, what can I say? This just means we'll have to be even more careful to get out of here safely.

intro.speaker: Mordecai
intro.line: ...Someone is coming.

intro.speaker: Lucia
intro.line: Guards? This cave has only one exit... I guess that means we do this the hard way. We've obtained enough evidence to indict Ludveck, so there's no point in sticking around. Let's go!

boss.speaker: Maraj
boss.line: As I expected. The queen's house pets are playful little pups indeed. The only thing your sniffing about will get you, however, is an abruptly shortened life span!

boss.speaker: Maraj
boss.line: To associate with beasts like you... One has to wonder where the queen acquired such a lack of taste.

boss.speaker: Maraj
boss.line: My death...means nothing... Our plan...is perfect... There is... nothing...nothing the queen...can do...

boss.speaker: Maraj
boss.line: Well, look what we have here... Lady Lucia and her pack of curs. How interesting. What cause could you have for roaming the grounds at night, hmm?

boss.speaker: Lucia
boss.line: Cause? Why, we've merely lost our way.

boss.speaker: Maraj
boss.line: Is that so? In that case, I will gladly escort you back to the castle.

boss.speaker: Lucia
boss.line: That's quite all right. We should be going home. But please do give Lord Ludveck a message... Tell him that his revolt will never succeed!

boss.speaker: Maraj
boss.line: ...Tsk tsk. I did try to warn Lord Ludveck, but it seems that he is quite fond of you. If he knew of your little discovery... I'm certain he would have no qualms about eliminating you.

end.speaker: Lucia
end.line: This way!

end.speaker: Lucia
end.line: As we suspected, Lord Ludveck is intent on rebellion. His followers are spread across the land, inciting insurrection. We have the documents to prove it.

end.speaker: Geoffrey
end.line: Queen Elincia, I stand ready to defend the realm! I will lead the Royal Knights into Felirae, and we will seize the duke!

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: I am hesitant to resort to the sword without at least attempting diplomacy. At all costs, I must stop the people of Crimea from fighting one another.

end.speaker: Crimea
end.line: Your Majesty! News from the countryside! Duke Ludveck has assembled an army and announced his intentions against you! The rebellion in Felirae is growing quickly!

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: I see...

end.speaker: Lucia
end.line: He must have realized that his operations were no longer a secret. Your Majesty, we have no time to waste. We must stand against this, for the future of Crimea!

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: ...I understand. Geoffrey, leader of the Royal Knights... I hereby authorize the use of military force against the rebel army!

end.speaker: Geoffrey
end.line: Yes, Your Majesty. At once!

end.speaker: Lucia
end.line: I will begin marshalling forces. This rebellion must be stopped...before nobles in surrounding areas catch wind of it.

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: ...Am I doing the right thing? Oh, Father... Uncle Renning...

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: Welcome back, Marcia. Did you learn of Sir Ike's whereabouts?

end.speaker: Marcia
end.line: No... I'm sorry. I've got nothing but sore feet and a tired pegasus. I've talked to a few local villagers who say the Greil Mercenaries have been working low-paying odd jobs here and there. Nobody seems to know where they are now, but everyone agrees that this is the first time they've been gone for so long.

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: Princess Leanne, please try to keep your spirits high. I assure you, we will continue to investigate Sir Ike's whereabouts.

end.speaker: Leanne
end.line: Th-thank...you.

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: Oh! Princess Leanne! You spoke?!

end.speaker: Nealuchi
end.line: Quite a shock, yes? My lady has been studying your language, which we often call "modern speech."

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: That's wonderful! It's hard enough visiting a strange land, let alone learning the languages.

end.speaker: Leanne
end.line: Me...not big...no pr-problem. Queen Elincia has tr-trouble...heart.

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: Ah... I'd forgotten. The heron tribe can peer into the heart. I can't hide the pain I'm feeling... At least not from you, Princess Leanne.

end.speaker: Leanne
end.line: Queen... El...Elincia.

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: ...Why does this happen?! My people fight, brother against brother... And no matter what I do, I can't stop it! I'm a miserable failure. I just want to crawl into a cave somewhere. How can anyone believe in me now?

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: I never asked for any of this... I never wanted to be queen!

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: ...Sniff... I can't... I can't do it anymore...

narration: Insurrection erupts across Crimea. The wounds Crimea suffered during the conflict with Daein have finally begun to heal, and it should be rejoicing in its hard-won peace. How is it that the fires of rebellion have been lit?

Bastian, Queen Elincia's most trusted advisor, widely acknowledged for his political savvy, is on a mission to Daein, and the Greil Mercenaries, the original authors of Crimea's recovery, are nowhere to be found.
Queen Elincia, close to despair, has nonetheless ordered the Crimean Royal Knights to restore order in Felirae. Her only wish is to win the coming battle, so that she may stave off a civil war.

conversation.speaker: Heather
conversation.line: Awww... I really wanted to go to the palace. I would've been happy with just a tiny little glance at Queen Elincia. She's... glorious. This is so unfair!

conversation.speaker: Brom
conversation.line: Yup, it's the pits. But that queen of ours is a real nice lady. Knowin' her, she'd prob'ly just let ya talk to 'er, noble or not.

conversation.speaker: Heather
conversation.line: The nerve of that Duke Ludveck! He ruined my one chance to meet the queen. I won't stand for it! He needs a kick in the rear! Or a punch in the mouth! The things I'd do to him...

conversation.speaker: Nephenee
conversation.line: Uhm... Heather? You sure are a lovely gal and all, but... You sure do say some funny things.

conversation.speaker: Brom
conversation.line: Can't argue with that, Nephenee. But that's just the way folks are. They ain't always what they appear to be. Ain't nobody perfect, neither. 'Less you're talkin' 'bout the goddess, that is.
Excuse me...

conversation.speaker: Heather
conversation.line: Hm?

conversation.speaker: Nephenee
conversation.line: Oh!

conversation.speaker: Brom
conversation.line: Well! Hi there, Miss Lucia. What can we help ya with?

conversation.speaker: Lucia
conversation.line: I came to ask for a favor. If it's not too much to ask, I'd like you both to accompany me to Felirae.

conversation.speaker: Brom
conversation.line: Hmm. Naw, that won't be a problem. You goin' ta catch the duke?

conversation.speaker: Lucia
conversation.line: Something a little more... preliminary. I guess you could call it espionage.

conversation.speaker: Brom
conversation.line: Espio-what? Sounds serious! Nephenee, you ever hearda that?

conversation.speaker: Nephenee
conversation.line: Oh, sure. When I was just a sprout, I caught a real bad case'a that. I got this awful rash all over my back, too!

conversation.speaker: Lucia
conversation.line: Uh... That's... a very nice story. Maybe I'd better explain what I mean.

conversation.speaker: Heather
conversation.line: Don't you know anything!? Espionage is all about stealing secrets and not getting caught. It's one of my many strong points!

conversation.speaker: Lucia
conversation.line: Oh, really? And who might you be?

conversation.speaker: Heather
conversation.line: My name is Heather! I'm a friend of Nephenee's. I'd do ANYTHING to help Her Majesty. Seriously, anything!

conversation.speaker: Lucia
conversation.line: ...I see. Maybe you can lend a hand as well.

conversation.speaker: Heather
conversation.line: Miss Lucia, you're the greatest! Like, amazingly stupendously great! I'd love to help!

conversation.speaker: Lethe
conversation.line: Lady Lucia! We've heard a rumor that you'll be leaving to investigate an enemy. Is this true?

conversation.speaker: Lucia
conversation.line: Lady Lethe, Sir Mordecai... I... Well...

conversation.speaker: Lethe
conversation.line: We could return to Gallia and bring back soldiers to help, you know. As an ally in a time of crisis, I'm certain our king would lend support.

conversation.speaker: Lucia
conversation.line: No, Lady Lethe. This is an internal affair. We don't want to have to involve Gallia in Crimea's civil problems.

conversation.speaker: Mordecai
conversation.line: More fighters are always better. The people of Gallia... All will fight for Queen Elincia.

conversation.speaker: Lucia
conversation.line: Listen, I know you mean well, but I just can't allow it. I'm sorry, but if there were even a hint of Gallia's assistance, there would be even more problems in the royal court.

conversation.speaker: Mordecai
conversation.line: Problems? What problems?

conversation.speaker: Lethe
conversation.line: This conflict isn't exactly a life-or-death situation for Crimea, so... Relying on support from a laguz nation would cause an uproar with the nobility. Is that what you mean?

conversation.speaker: Lucia
conversation.line: Yes, unfortunately. I'm ashamed to admit it, but it's the truth.

conversation.speaker: Lethe
conversation.line: No. It's common sense, given the history of both our nations. I completely understand. We won't report this to Gallia.

conversation.speaker: Lucia
conversation.line: Thank you for understanding. I apologize for troubling you.

conversation.speaker: Mordecai
conversation.line: No, it is fine.

conversation.speaker: Lethe
conversation.line: Why this tactic of rousing the people to rebel against the queen, though? Any laguz who wanted to be king would fight for it with teeth and claws, as is proper. You beorc are always wasting time talking.

conversation.speaker: Lucia
conversation.line: Our society is very complex. There's history and tradition, unwritten law and custom. There are lots of reasons for why we--

conversation.speaker: Lethe
conversation.line: Bah! Attempts to compromise won't get you anywhere. You should just kill him and get it over with.

conversation.speaker: Mordecai
conversation.line: Mordecai feels sad. Poor Queen Elincia... We cannot help her.

conversation.speaker: Lucia
conversation.line: That's not true, Mordecai. Having support from you and Lethe is very helpful.

conversation.speaker: Mordecai
conversation.line: Really? Mordecai will help with anything!

conversation.speaker: Lucia
conversation.line: Hmm. I have a great idea. Together with the laguz...

conversation.speaker: Leanne
conversation.line: (I'll go too!)

conversation.speaker: Lucia
conversation.line: Princess Leanne? Why do I suddenly have a crowd?

conversation.speaker: Lethe
conversation.line: She says that she'd like to go.

conversation.speaker: Lucia
conversation.line: No, I'm sorry. It's much too dangerous where we're going. I couldn't risk something happening to you.

conversation.speaker: Nealuchi
conversation.line: Hoo hoo! I guess this mangy old coot will be joining the action, then! To ensure my lady's safety, of course.

conversation.speaker: Lucia
conversation.line: Sir Neluchi, as well? Stars above...

conversation.speaker: Lucia
conversation.line: Your Majesty...?

conversation.speaker: Elincia
conversation.line: OK... All finished.

conversation.speaker: Lucia
conversation.line: What are you doing?

conversation.speaker: Elincia
conversation.line: Don't worry about it. It's a secret.

conversation.speaker: Lucia
conversation.line: Aha! That was a needle and thread, wasn't it?! Did you just sew something into my collar?

conversation.speaker: Elincia
conversation.line: It's a good-luck charm. To keep you safe while you're away. So you'll come back to me in one piece.

conversation.speaker: Lucia
conversation.line: Elincia...

conversation.speaker: Elincia
conversation.line: Be careful out there. I'll be praying for you.

conversation.speaker: Lucia
conversation.line: Thanks. I'll be back with good news. I promise.

conversation.speaker: Geoffrey
conversation.line: Lucia, wait!

conversation.speaker: Lucia
conversation.line: You can't stop me, Geoffrey.

conversation.speaker: Geoffrey
conversation.line: I know that. But I can try to keep you safe, can't I? So I'd like you to take this.

conversation.speaker: Lucia
conversation.line: An elixir? I don't need it. I'm just... I'm not going to fight, you know.

conversation.speaker: Geoffrey
conversation.line: If you don't use it, so much the better. But just hold on to it. For me.

conversation.speaker: Lucia
conversation.line: All right.

conversation.speaker: Geoffrey
conversation.line: Promise me you won't do anything stupid. Promise for Elincia and me. And for Bastian.

conversation.speaker: Lucia
conversation.line: For you to even mention his name at a time like this... I give up. Sure, I promise. Keep Queen Elincia safe, got it?

conversation.speaker: Geoffrey
conversation.line: Of course. On my life.
